term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - reorganization in polymers
term.title: reorganization

item.text: The molecular process by which (i) amorphous or poorly ordered regions of a polymer specimen become incorporated into crystals, or (ii) a change to a more stable crystal structure takes place, or (iii) defects within the crystal decrease.

notes.item: secondary crystallization may be involved in the reorganization process.
Points (i) and (ii) above may also be called crystal perfection.
